intro: Schoberia parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered schoberia, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, branched stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers appear in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Schoberia parviflora is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to temperate climates with cold winters.
